text: A very nice place in the extreme east plateau.  We had the burger and the fish and chips off the limited afternoon menu.  The burger was quite good, maybe lacking a distinct flavor or character, but with nicely seasoned beef cooked absolutely perfectly - between medium and medium-rare.  The fish was very lightly breaded with a very light flavor.  The tartar sauce was tasty with an accent of dill.    This is of course also a brew pub and I sampled a couple of their beers.  The Saison Mixte was excellent; a spicy white beer with a hint of sour.  My girlfriend had the one cider on the menu and it was also very good, not overly sweet with an appealing sour note.  My girlfriend felt it was important to add that the music selection was terrible.  I'll add that while that's true at least it was at a low enough volume to ignore.

Prices are very reasonable, and it's an interesting spot for beer lovers. However, the space itself is cold and sterile, and the service was inattentive. We waited a good 15 minutes for someone to come take our order, and after we were served, it's like the staff forgot about us. Many of them were chatting amongst themselves behind the bar. I won't be returning.

4e arrêt avec notre passeport en fût! Une bonne adresse sur la Plateau, bien décorée qui sert de galerie en même temps (plusieurs tableaux magnifiques y sont exposés). Serveur sympathique et courtois qui nous a recommandé d'excellentes bières exclusives à Boswell: la Café Rico Breakfast Stout qui a un goût très prononcé de café et la Chipotle Brown Porter, qui est assez épicée mais qui se prend très bien, j'ai adoré! Un endroit à revisiter une autre journée qu'un dimanche soir de décembre quand il y aura un peu plus de monde :)

Déjà deux visites chez Boswell et j'en redemande! Je peux vous dire que c'est rare car avec l'offre de bar et restaurant dans Montréal, il y en a très peu que j'ai fais deux fois et aucun deux fois dans le même mois à mon souvenir.  Bon c'est vrai, c'est vraiment proche de chez moi. C'est vrai mais ce n'est pas la seule raison. Car au Boswell, j'ai déjà envie d'y retourner. Pour découvrir de nouvelles bières, me faire conseiller par des serveurs-euses sympathiques et souriants, manger des plats tous goûteux et être dans une ambiance de fête alors que c'est juste un vendredi soir comme les autres.  C'est ça Boswell, de la bière, de la bouffe, de l'ambiance. Simple et efficace. J'ai pas besoin de plus pour un gros coup de cur.

Been here a couple of times. Chill, large space, friendly service and my partner loves the beer selection. Second time we went for dinner and it turns out it was quiz night, which was a lot of fun. My only complaint: please introduce a vegan (not vegetarian) option to the menu!
Excellent flavor, generous portions, great beer. How often do you find all three in one place? I'll be bringing company next time.
Located in a quiet neighborhood. Drinks were good. The food was simple.Great outdoor seating in the front.

We were just looking for a casual place to grab a nice-er dinner, and found this place just 250 meters away from the new apartment.   The place was quiet, but it was pretty early on Sunday night, nice darker atmosphere, lots of seating and clean. (Seems like a rad place to bring a pile of friends for a good drink and some yummy food.)  Great staff, french only menus but anglo friendly.  We got the Westcoast IPA, chicken karaage, fish and chips, and their burger!  I'm always so impressed when I find a place that knows how to cook food here in Montreal. The karaage was PERFECT. Crispy, light breading with moist chicken. The fish and chips were the same, beautifully battered and crisp but not greasy. The burger could have been cooked a tiny bit less but it was still delicious. They also have VERY awesome thick-cut fries, I imagine poutine on them is incredible.  We'll definitely back either for a few drinks with friends or another nice dinner!
Amazing food and delicious beer! A great little neighborhood spot with excellent service.

When in town try this brasserie for a cold one and nibble. The brews are great but then Canada is known for its beer!   Really nice atmosphere, local kinda bar. We came for a quick drink before dinner with my old friend. We found it casual, fun and the staff attentive. Local so French primary  language but some spoke English. So enjoyed our beer.  Definitely recommended!

Wow! Words cannot describe how amazing our meal here was last Saturday evening. This was a meal to remember with amazing service, highest quality food, beautiful ambiance, and it didn't break the bank! You MUST try this place!  The restaurant was situated in a sparser stretch of rue Mont Royal. It didn't particularly beckon us in from the street but it was packed with patrons - our first clue that we were in for a treat. My boyfriend and I shared several of the appetizers (salmon tartare, calamari, beet salad and duck prosciutto plate).   The food was beautifully presented and SO GOOD. Flavourful, fresh, and using high quality ingredients. The beer was also very very good. Our server Jeremy was friendly, helpful and very genuine. We had nice conversation and he gave us recommendations for other eateries during our time in Quebec.   This is a must-try when you are in Montreal. Just down the street from la Distillerie and a short drive to the bustling St Denis strip with more bars and clubs.

Nous y sommes allées dans le cadre de Montréal à table et nous n'avons pas regretté notre choix! Située sur Mont Royal pas loin du parc Baldwin, loin de la section achalandée, la brasserie, bien visible de l'extérieur, vous plonge dans une atmosphère agréable et conviviale dès votre entrée! Lumières tamisées, peintures et couleurs chaudes, vous vous y sentirez bien! Le menu était très bon et surtout très correct pour 21$ entrée plat dessert! Les photos parlent d'elles-même.. Service extra, serveur aux petits soins bourrés de bons conseils et de recommandations. A essayer sans plus tarder!

I found the food and service overall to be decent, but my main was over salted and I had difficulty finishing it.  Although the atmosphere is pleasant, it was quite dark and a bit hard to see what I was eating.  Not sure I'd come back with so many other options in the area.

We enjoyed a great meal during our time in Montreal! Their beer list is extensive and they have a few beers that they have brewed themselves, which was a nice change of pace. My husband enjoyed one of their IPA's that they brewed along with a brown ale and I enjoyed the framboise cider. (I am keeping my fingers crossed that somehow I will be able to find this in Chicago, as I had it in both Quebec and Montreal as it is DELISH!)   The food was very good and the portions were a good size. My husband's fish and chips were nice and crispy and the tartar sauce was very flavorful. I had the chicken fajitas, which was more like a chicken wrap as opposed to fajitas served the way I am used to; however, they were very flavorful and fresh.   Service was attentive and not overbearing, which is also appreciated. We will definitely be back if we return to Montreal. .

Parles-moi d'un coup de coeur!   La rue Mont-Royal est damnée; à chaque fois qu'une lumière tourne au vert, un commerce de l'Avenue ouvre et ferme lorsque ça vire au rouge. Ils ont peut-être compris ça, Boswell, lorsqu'ils ont ouvert leur brasserie artisanale tout au bout de la rue, où il ne se passe pas grand chose et donc là où la concurrence se fait plus tranquille. Mais là, tu dois te demander ce qui m'a attiré ici à la base, à part du fait que la bière, j'aime ben ça. Ok, regarde:  On est jeudi, à peine 13h, j'ai pas de cours demain, mais mille travaux scolaires à faire parce que #PasDePauseEntreLaMiSessionEtLaFinDeSession. Je commence mes démarches de productivité dans un café, mais ça marche pas. Alors que l'espoir me quitte, je me rappelle d'une image vue sur Facebook; une brasserie qui t'invite à venir faire tes travaux avec ton laptop grâce à leur merveilleux wi-fi, leur machine à café top notch et leur bière pas chère. Il ne m'en faut pas plus pour me déplacer jusqu'au dit-endroit. Même pas 2 minutes après mon arrivée, mon coeur avait déjà explosé: Émilie, ma serveuse, était totalement adorable, la sélection de bière en fût (totalement québécoise, en passant) était exceptionnelle et la musique était parfaite. Deux heures, des fajitas au poulet et deux bières plus tard, je peux quitter en me disant que j'ai trouvé mon nouveau working spot favori.  Tu veux une raison pour les aimer encore plus? Petit secret pas tant secret: Ils commenceront sous peu à brasser leur propre bière dans l'espace juste à côté, et d'ici un an ils prévoient pouvoir présenter une carte de bières en fut dont plus de la moitié seront leur création! C'est à surveiller!   On parie donc que je serai bientôt de retour parce que de 1: je suis dans un tourbillon infini de travaux d'école et que j'ai besoin d'un sanctuaire ou recueillir mes pleurs l'après-midi (lire: pendant que je fais les dits-devoirs) et les boire en soirée (la bière est 5$ si tu te pointes entre 17 et 19h, j'dis ça de même), et de 2: La bière, j'aime ben ça.

The staff was extremely helpful and friendly in providing local recommendations to us. There was a timing issue on our burgers coming out, but overall it was a good dining experience. Cheeseburgers and fries were good.

I consider Boswell my second home.  I have been there countless times since their opening in 2015.  They always have a great selection of micro-brewery beers, local ciders and one kombucha.    All tap beverages are $6, with the glass size changing depending on the choice and alcohol percentage.   They also have a pretty decent selection of local liquors for Shooters or drinks. If you're looking at ordering shots, I strongly suggest you ask for an Hot Shot, which is a mix of Whisky and expresso.   The staff is great to help with your selection and they will gladly bring you a sample before you place an order.  The food is amazing, the menu is short but they have different items on the menu every week, with seasonal plates.   They have free Wi-Fi if you want to go to study or work.   The atmosphere is whatever you make it to be; Quiet to study alone  Perfect for a date  Nice and fun for a small group of friends  Party mode for special occasions

Funky atmosphere. We got there around 7,  there was still seating left but was full-up an hour later. Very good pub food a great selection of hand crafted beers and delicious too.   The appetizers were all delicious --  fried tofu, cod balls served with yogurt and a really fresh 'relish' and some chicken bites that were also very yummy -- all fried so if you are on a diet...but well worth the splurge!  For the main I had the Hamburger and fries -- the burger was very tasty ( quite the stack ), my only complaint is that the burger was a bit dry. I asked for it medium and was told, that by law they are not allowed to serve it that way and have to cook it to temp -- husband had fish and chips and they were crispy on the outside and fluffy and moist on the inside , fires are very good -- generous portion  Very reasonably priced and well worth it.  Almost forgot to mention the wait staff was very friendly and attentive also. Thank you!

Je baisse la note de 2 étoiles suite à une seconde hausse des prix au niveau du menu de bouffe. La première hausse est compréhensible mais je trouve que la deuxième est de trop. Ok la première permettait de récompenser le bon travail et me semblait légitime mais maintenant on a perdu le bon rapport de prix qui faisait la force du Boswell il y a quelques temps. Par exemple voir les fajitas passer de 10$ à 12$ puis 14$ ca fait trop pour moi en un peine 1 an. Dommage pour le consommateur que je suis, tant mieux pour les gérants.

Great atmosphere, clean and lots of space. A great place to hang out and enjoy their varied selection of beers! Milkshake IPA was a favorite. Also appreciated is how they offer small 4oz pours so many can be tried.

I wouldn't have known this place if it wasn't for my good friend who decided to get married in a microbrew focused pub!  Compared with a lot of other places downtown, prices are a lot more wallet friendly.  They had a whole bunch of beers that I've never heard of but tasted great. Food was also better than what one would usually expect for a pub.

Très agréable comme soirée! Nous y sommes allés dans le cadre du Passeport en fût et nous avons décidé de souper là-bas aussi ! La bière était très bonne et il y a beaucoup de choix. Les plats commandés étaient tout simplement délicieux ! Nous avons mangé le poulet karagee en entrée et le hamburger et la pieuvre en repas! Le hamburger vaut vraiment la peine! La pieuvre était bonne, mais l'assiette est petite et bizarrement présentée ! Le service était formidable ! Je recommande cette place à tous !

This pub is a little closer to home. First time there. Seating is arrange to encourage exchange with your neighbors. Good craft beers and some from other local breweries. My friend and I had a burger and I got a fries as a side. Good food. Fries are home made and just right.

High-energy, popular and hip spot- was packed on a Thursday night. Lighting is very dim, which I'm fine with but could be a problem if you want to see your menu. Fish and chips were spectacular - my sister had the Portobello burger, which was also delicious.

I'm giving it one star less because of the overcrowded/can't-hear-your-neighbour ambience but the people are friendly enough and the food is great.   Despite not having English menus on hand, all the staff speak great English so feel free to ask them to explain the dishes to you.   Our meal arrived quite a while later, prob 30 mins but it was quite busy that Saturday night.   I ordered a tofu vegetarian burger which I knew was going to be risky - but it was amazing & full of flavour. The brioche bun was perfectly sized & fresh, there was some sliced tofu, mushroom, Swiss chard and dijonnaise which came together in a blissful combination.   The serve of frites with the burgers are quite generous so if that doesn't satisfy you I don't know what will!

Wonderful, wonderful pub. Modern, spacious, long tables suitable for bigger or smaller groups. A little bit noisy, but that's fine, it is a pub in the end. Big advantage, no TV screens, love the fact that I can enjoy talking to my friends instead of staring at moving figures on the wall.   The beer list is outstanding, beautiful selection of some of the best local beer producers, the two pints I had were delicious. Nice, carefully balanced food menu with snacks, appetizers and some mains options. I went for the crispy calamari that were really crispy, but a little bit over salted.   The brew prices are very competitive, six dollars, taxes included. Location wise it is a little bit too far east for me, but parking is so easy to find at this part of Mont Royal street that I have no excuse! I'll be back!

Enfin! Enfin! Enfin!  On peut boire de la bonne bière sur Mont-Royal!  Si je l'ai attendu, mon bar à bières, depuis que j'habite le quartier!   C'est que pour se faire servir autre chose que de la boréale ou de la McAusland en fût sur Mont-Royal (sans parler, bien sûr, des eaux fades de Molson et de Labatt, qui n'ont de la bière que le nom), c'est la croix et la bannière...   MAIS PLUS MAINTENANT! Hourrah! 21 bières en fût, dont un cask, provenant de nombreux brasseurs des quatres coins du Québec, un seul prix : 6$! Un des meilleurs à Montréal! Le décors est correct, un peu trop hipster pour moi (qui préfère l'ambiance vieille taverne), mais de bon ton.  Service très attentionné.  Cuisine ouverte jusqu'à minuit.  Choix de bouffe intéressant pour ce genre d'établissement: des burgers, des tartares, des calmars frits (j'ai bien aimé leurs nachos: quelle bonne idée que de les assaisonner d'oignons marinés et de tapenade!).  Seul bémol en ce vendredi soir: musique un poil trop forte et un poil trop branchée.  Quelque chose d'un peu plus folk, ou jazzé, voire même un peu trip hop auraient, selon moi, peut-être un peu mieux convenu à l'endroit, mais ça, c'est question de goût personnel...  Peut-être que c'est seulement moi qui vieillit... :( En tous les cas, j'y retournerai incessament, c'est certain!

Spacious but still a warm atmosphere. Very friendly and attentive staff. Considering it's about the only place in this neighborhood I was afraid it would be much more about the brewery than the food but I was happily surprised. Food is actually very tasty and portions are just perfect. Not a 5* because I found it a bit pricey though.

Je reviens de ma première visite. La carte des bières est excellente. La Grande Noirceur de Dieu du Ciel ! servit à l'Azote liquide, je ne sais pas si c'est une exclusivité, mais c'est du jamais vu pour moi! 15-17 bière en fût avec rotation de baril démontre que cet endroit prend sa bière micro très au sérieux. Le concept est intéressant. 6$, 3 formats et 1  4ieme format dégustation 3$ (de 8oz a 16onze). J'ai mangé un flanc de porc croustillant avec purée d'avocat et Chutney de papaye avec salade de bettrave jaune. Excellent repas pour 18$  avec un portion bistro (environ 400-500 gr).  Bonne chose la carte indique que tout est taxe incluse donc le calcul de la soirée est très facile.   J'ai eut une première serveuse avec un excellent service. La seconde semblait beaucoup plus intéressée par sa soirée que la qualité de la mienne. J'ai donné avec un certain remord un tip de 10%. J'ai attendu plus de 22 minutes pour ma facture et sur les 2 des 3 consommations sous son service j'ai bêtement gardé ma main en l'air pendant 3-5 minutes avant d'Avoir son attention. J'ai vu durant ces moments d'attentes la jeune serveuse ingurgité de la bière et 2 shooters.   Maintenant j'uvre dans le domaine du service à la clientèle et il est impératif pour moi que mes clients soient servit comme j'aurais aimé l'être. Dans ce cas-ci j'ai ressenti un manque de motivation catégorique de l'employé et surtout un je-m'en-foutisme.   À la fin de la soirée, après les 22 minutes d'attentes pour la facture, dans un bars pas du tout occupé, elle m'a demandé si j'ai aimé ma soirée.   J'ai dit oui, mais ce n'était certainement pas à cause d'elle mais bien grâce à ma première serveuse, l'ambiance, la nourriture et bien sur, l'incroyable qualité de la carte des bières.
Microbrasserie is the best. Super micro, le bar est écourant, à conseiller ipa et la stout au café excellent. Ambiance jeunesse et très qool, à conseiller 8.5/10

Très belle micro-brasserie sur l'avenue Mont-Royal, bel intérieur, bonnes sélections de bières de différentes micro-brasseries du Québec (Les Trois Mousquetaires, Loup Rouge, Isle de Garde, Micro du Lac, ...) servies en différentes grosseurs de verres/pintes de 8oz / 12 oz / 16oz pour 6$. Assis au bar, service rapide et courtois, ma Oktoberfest et Porter Baltique étaient exquises et les calmars (10$) de mon ami aussi. Belle ambiance, assez remplis de gens, je n'ai que des bons mots. Il me faut y retourner pour essayer d'autres de leurs sélections de bières. Wifi gratuit. Carte de crédits acceptées.  5/5 visité en novembre 2015

Amazing! Rotating taps, and so many wonderful beers to chose from.   The server was extremely attentive. The second my beers were finished, she was ready to get me a new one!   I sat at the bar, which was great because I was able to watch what was going on in the kitchen. The tables are also wonderful, spacious and can seat a large group.   The crowd was a mix of old and young, classy and rowdy.   The food was great as well (tip is included in the price). My boyfriend and I ordered the beef tartare and two of the specials (Kaage Chicken with a delicious kimchi, and A Calamari and Chorizo dish that was ok-the sauce was a bit smoky but not bad).  They serve popcorn as a snack for $5 and all beers are $6.  Great experience, check it out.
